author: StormSworder
title: A must-have for any Lego town.
review: This was also my first set of minifigs, really takes me back.  I remember giving them all names, and thinking that woman with the mug was a man with long hair (to this day I've still no idea why I thought that).  A very useful collection of people to help populate any lego town.

author: CamberbrickGreen
title: Classic Citizens
review:
This is probably my first or second actual boxed set. Kept them in a small pencil case to take to my friends. In need of rebuild, their wasted torsos lie scattered throughout some boxes.

Minifigures:

[··][··][··][··][··]

  • Pan and dough/bread.
  • Blue torso with tie under jacket print.
  • Classic construction worker.
  • Smart jacket and shirt torso.
  • Retro striped top.
The legendary Baker is probably the best while the man with the black cap and megaphone could be a train station master. The builder has the trusty minifigure pick axe (hacks through plastic?) the blue fatigues ever a basic but favourite uniform. The wealthy heir? (looks like Richie Rich's dad) is just posting a letter but is a good character with among the smartest of old torsos. But oh no! In 1982 the two women just sweep up and drink coffee! At least they get a retro striped top and some jewellery - gold beads indeed!

Legends Of Townsfolk
The best collection of everyday citizens and trades people, it made bakers/chefs a personal favourite and gave some depth and characters to our towns. The prints remain simplistic but strong and imagination converts everything. All that collectors have come to know and love about minifigures since they grew arms, legs and faces can be found in this box as one of just a couple of Town subtheme origins.

Iconic
This could remain among the more likeable town minifigure sets, though I am sure everyone has their 'era's' choice box. The last made was actually very good: 
http://www.brickset.com/detail/?Set=8401-1. 
Icons, the lot of them with a couple of eternal favourites, each character could inspire the need for a building: bakery, construction site, train platform, mansion? The longevity of use makes one of such a release unmissable among the various Town MF sets. For some of us, it all started here...

author: Niki124
title: Very nice ensemble
review:
This was a good variety of figures to add to our Legoland City lineup. Each appears to have their own background or story, though we could never quite figure out who the redheaded lady was - the Lady Mayoress sweeping up after the Mayor, or a cleaning lady with a big line in jewellery? Everyone else appeared to have a role as the postmaster, a street cook, a roadworks engineer, a bossy man with a loudhailer, or someone who drank coffee for a living. They could always help out at our Snack Bar or Post Office. 

There would be some scope to change the outfits (ie the leg parts) round, but it's not something we considered at the time. But this set was ideal to pad out our Legoland scenes and provide a few customers to our growing collection of stores.
